class KL_QP(model, guide, optim_step_fct, model_fixed=False, guide_fixed=False, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: object

Parameters:
  • model – probabilistic model defined as a function
  • guide – guide used for sampling defined as a function
  • optim – optimization function
  • model_fixed (bool) – flag for if the model is fixed
  • guide_fixed (bool) – flag for if the guide is fixed

This method performs variational inference by minimizing the KL-divergence between the actual and approximate posterior.

Example:

from pyro.infer.kl_qp import KL_QP

kl_optim = KL_QP(model, guide,
                 pyro.optim(torch.optim.Adam, {"lr": .001}))
for k in range(n_steps):
# optimize
kl_optim.step()
step(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Takes a single step of optimization
